item.description:
Almost 1,200 acres of land make up the natural environment atHodges Village Dam, located in Oxford, MA. Over 15 miles of trails are maintained for hiking.

On the west side of the French River are upland hardwoods, red oak, white oak and hickory. The east side of Hodges Village Dam supports an Atlantic White Cedar swamp and numerous shrub swamps and forested wetlands. Red maple, alder, birch and other common wetland plants are found in the widespread wetlands. Deer, rabbits, ducks, geese, raccoons, fox, turkey, and a variety of songbirds are some the wildlife inhabiting these natural areas.

Directions:
Hodges Village Dam is located in Oxford, Massachusetts, easily accessible from the Massachusetts Turnpike and Interstate 395. Take Exit 4B on I-395 to Oxford. Go through Oxford Center and continue straight for one-half mile to Howarth Road. Turn right. From the Massachusetts Turnpike, take the Sturbridge exit and follow Route 20 to Charlton. From here take a right on to Route 31 and follow the signs to Hodges Village Dam.

Please be sure to bring plenty of water and lunch to enjoy along the way. Hike will last about 2-3 hours depending on how all feel.

If your running late please call 508-415-0590. Be sure to check Funseekers! site prior to leaving in case any details have changed or due to weather hike must be cancelled.

For additional information visit: http://www.ohranger.com/hodges-village-dam

To download trail map visit: http://www.nae.usace.army.mil/Portals/74/docs/Recreation/HVDProjectMap.pdf
We'll stay on the non-mortorized easy and moderate trails heading up towards French River Bridge, then Wellington Pond and the back down to to Hodges Village Dam.
item.name: Hike at Hodges Village Dam
